data.title: Joe DiMaggio (Baseball Player)
data.meta_description: Baseball hero during the 1930s and 40s known as "Joltin' Joe" and "The Yankee Clipper". Marrying Marilyn Monroe added to his fame.
data.text:
Joe DiMaggio

Profession: Baseball Player

Biography: Baseball hero during the 1930s and 40s known as "Joltin' Joe" and "The Yankee Clipper".

Marrying Marilyn Monroe added to his fame.

Born: November 25, 1914

Birthplace: Martinez, California, USA

Generation: Greatest Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Tiger

Star Sign: Sagittarius

Died: March 8, 1999 (aged 84)

Cause of Death: Lung cancer

Playing Career

Joe DiMaggio ends 61 game hitting streak in Pacific Coast League

NY Yankees buy Joe DiMaggio from SF Seals (Pacific Coast League)

NY Yankee Joe DiMaggio makes his major-league debut, gets 3 hits

Rookie outfielder Joe DiMaggio ties 3 MLB records in New York's 10-run 5th inning against the White Sox, hitting 2 home runs for 8 total bases; Yankees beat Chicago, 18-4

Joe DiMaggio takes Ty Cobb's advice and replaces his 40 oz bat with a 36 oz one

Joe DiMaggio hits 3 consecutive HRs against St Louis Browns

NY Yankees outfielder Joe DiMaggio hits 20th HR of the season but 1st career grand slam in 8-4 win vs Boston Red Sox

New York Yankees pitcher Monte Pearson no-hits Cleveland Indians, 13-0; Joe DiMaggio hits 3 triples

Joe DiMaggio wins AL MVP, Jimmie Foxx is runner-up

New York Yankees Joe DiMaggio starts 56-game hitting streak, with the only RBI, in a 13-1 loss to visiting Chicago White Sox

New York Yankees outfielder Joe DiMaggio, on way to a record 56, ties Willie Keeler's 44 game MLB hit streak in a 9-2 win over Boston Red Sox at Yankee Stadium

Joe DiMaggio hits a 3-run homer off Boston's Dick Newsome to pass Willie Keeler's MLB record 44 game hitting streak

Joe Dimaggio goes 3 for 4, hitting in his 56th straight game

NY Yankee Joe DiMaggio's 56-game hitting streak ends in Cleveland

Joe DiMaggio goes 0-4 in Yankees 6-2 loss v St. Louis Browns, ending his on-base streak of 74 games, 2nd in MLB history

New York Yankee Joe DiMaggio is named AL MVP, for the 2nd time

NY Yankee Joe DiMaggio enlists into the US army

Brooklyn outfielder Al Gionfriddo makes famous catch off Joe DiMaggio in Game 6 of Baseball World Series; Dodgers beat Yankees, 8-6; catch inspires "back-back-back" expression

Joe DiMaggio wins his 3rd MVP, beating Ted Williams by 1 vote

NY Yank Joe Dimaggio hits for cycle (single, double, triple, HR)

Future Baseball Hall of Fame center fielder Joe DiMaggio hits 3 consecutive HRs as the New York Yankees edge the Indians, 6-5 at Cleveland Stadium

Joe DiMaggio becomes 1st $100,000 a year baseball player for the New York Yankees

Joe DiMaggio gets his 2,000th hit, a 7th-inning single off Chick Pieretti, in a 8-2 victory over Cleveland

In a 4 for 38 slump, New York Yankees great Joe DiMaggio is benched for first time; replacement Cliff Mapes hits a HR in 7-6 win over Philadelphia Athletics

Joe DiMaggio becomes 1st to hit 3 HR in a game at Griffith Stadium

Yankee Joe DiMaggio and manager Casey Stengel feud after Stengel pulls DiMaggio out of game

Lefty O'Doul's all-stars, including Joe DiMaggio and Billy Martin, lose 3-1 to Pacific League all-star team (Japan)

Joe DiMaggio announces his retirement from baseball

Joe DiMaggio is hired as executive VP of A's by Charlie Finley

Yankees dedicate plaques to Mickey Mantle & Joe DiMaggio

1st annual Cracker Jack Old-Timers Baseball Classic: 75-year-old Luke Appling hits a 275-foot HR off Warren Spahn, as AL beats NL 7-2; participants included Hank Aaron, Lou Brock, Bert Campaneris, Joe DiMaggio, Stan Musial, Don Newcombe, and Early Wynn (RFK Stadium, Washington, D.C.)

Personal Life

American baseball legend Joe DiMaggio (24) weds American "Freshies" actress Dorothy Arnold (21) at St. Peter and Paul Church, with thousands of onlookers crowding the streets of in San Francisco, California; divorce in 1944

American NY Yankee baseball player Joe DiMaggio weds American actress Marilyn Monroe (27), the 2nd time for both), at San Francisco City Hall; divorce in 1955

Famous Baseball Players

David Justice

Ed Walsh

Ichiro Suzuki

Jim Bunning

Joe Torre

Ron Guidry
